translation.en: [man] Good God.
[woman] Oh, my Lord.
[man] Is this fucking Bosnia?
[woman] Look at this.
[Blaustein] Slow down, please.
Oh, boy.
[Blaustein] At that time, I was 26 years old.
I was a rookie journalist covering this high-profile festival.
translation.ko: 신참 기자로서 사람들의 관심이 집중됐던 이 축제를 취재했어요

translation.en: I was spending a lot of time in the press compound,
reporting back to New York City.
And it was a lot of fun…
until this happened.
And I'm looking around at all of this damage.
Carnage, if you will.
And I'm thinking, how the fuck did this happen?
[stage announcer] Woodstock '99!
Woodstock '99, baby! Yeah!
[Scott] It was amazing.
I'd never seen anything like it.
It was a history-making moment. Like, I can't believe I'm part of this.
translation.ko: 역사적인 순간이었고 제가 현장에 있다니 꿈만 같았죠

translation.en: Whoo! Hi, guys.
[Sara] It really felt like it was flower power
and love and music and coming together in harmony.
translation.ko: 사랑, 음악이 조화를 이루는 것 같았어요

translation.en: [Heather] There was not a doubt in my mind.
This was gonna be an experience of a lifetime.
[Scott] In the beginning, everyone was happy. The music was good.
Put your hands up in the air.
And of course, everyone just high as balls.
[girl] Yeah, baby!
[man] Woodstock. Woodstock.
Yeah!
There was this ominous feeling. There was no control.
This was not a walk in the park. We'd completely underestimated this.
translation.ko: 만만히 볼 일이 아니었죠 그 축제를 완전히 과소평가했어요

translation.en: Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! Whoo!
It was like this perfect storm had started to form.
translation.ko: 여러 가지 문제가 합쳐져 거대한 폭풍이 형성되고 있었죠

translation.en: These kids were getting pissed off.
Yeah!
[reporter] Things are just getting out of control.
[Kyle] Holy shit.
Some very, very bad things could happen.
translation.ko: 아주 나쁜 일이 생길 수도 있었죠

translation.en: [man] It's not part of the show. It really is a problem.
translation.ko: 이건 공연의 일부가 아닙니다 진짜 문제예요

translation.en: -[Blaustein] And that's it. -[man] Shit!
Kerosene, match.
Boom.
Holy shit. What the fuck?
It's like a scene with zombies coming over the castle walls.
It spiraled deeper and deeper into the worst demons of human nature.
translation.ko: 인간 본성의 가장 사악한 악마가 점점 더 추악한 모습을 드러냈죠

translation.en: This is fucking… I don't know, Lord of The Flies, man, I guess.
[Blaustein] There is no other way to describe it.
[man] Yeah!
It became a total and complete trainwreck.
[woman] Oh, my God.
[reporter] The Woodstock Music and Art Fair,
the three-day exposition at White Lake and Bethel, New York,
will give you uncomplicated, unhurried, calm days of peace and music.
translation.ko: 뉴욕주 베설, 화이트레이크에서 3일간 열리는 축제에서 평화와 음악이 어우러진 느긋하고 평온한 시간을 즐기세요

translation.en: There are over 600 acres to roam,
bazaars to browse. Heavy traffic is anticipated.
translation.ko: 2.4㎢가 넘는 부지를 돌아다니고 바자회를 둘러보세요 교통 체증이 예상되니

translation.en: So leave early to arrive on time.
♪ He was walking along the road ♪ ♪ When I asked him where… ♪
[Lewis] Woodstock is the original counterculture music festival, right?
I mean, it's basically that, and maybe the moon landing
translation.ko: 1960년대를 생각하면 그 축제와 달 착륙이 제일 먼저 떠오르죠

translation.en: is what you think of first when you think of the '60s.
translation.ko: 그 축제와 달 착륙이 제일 먼저 떠오르죠 "어낸다 루이스 MTV 진행자"

translation.en: It was the ultimate gathering of the best musicians
translation.ko: 음악의 최전성기에 최고의 음악가들이 한데 모인 "주얼 킬처 싱어송라이터"

translation.en: during the best era of music.
[Rossdale] Woodstock's one of those events
translation.ko: 우드스톡은 하나의 문화이자 DNA가 된 사건이었죠

translation.en: that's just part of culture and part of your DNA.
translation.ko: 우드스톡은 하나의 문화이자 DNA가 된 사건이었죠 "개빈 로스데일 부시의 리드 싱어"

translation.en: [reporter] Oh, boy.
I've never seen anything like this, man.
So, this whole Woodstock story really begins with one man.
translation.ko: 우드스톡 이야기는 이 한 사람에게서 시작됐죠

translation.en: Michael Lang.
Are you in charge of the whole thing?
Yeah.
[Lang] Woodstock was amazing.
translation.ko: 우드스톡은 끝내줬어요 "마이클 랭 우드스톡 공동 창립자"

translation.en: Hate to use "vibes," but there was amazing vibes in The Valley. [chuckles]
translation.ko: 분위기란 말은 쓰기 싫지만 밸리의 분위기는 끝내줬죠

translation.en: Obviously, the Vietnam War was a big thing.
We were so against it.
-You think you're gonna do another one? -If it works.
translation.ko: - 한 번 더 하실 건가요? - 성공하면요

translation.en: You know, for years, I didn't want to revive it.
I mean, I never thought we could have the same impact
of peace and love and flower power.
translation.ko: 그때와 같은 영향을 미칠 수 없다고 생각했죠

translation.en: But in the '90s, I started thinking about Woodstock for my kids' generation.
translation.ko: 그러다 1990년대에 제 자식 세대가 좋아할 만한 우드스톡을 구상했죠

translation.en: They were teenagers at the time.
When gun violence became an issue for all of us.
translation.ko: 총기 폭력이 사회적 문제가 됐을 때였죠

translation.en: [reporter] Two teenagers went on a five-hour rampage inside Columbine High School,
translation.ko: 10대 두 명이 콜럼바인 고교에서 5시간에 걸쳐 총기를 난사해

translation.en: killing 12 fellow students and a teacher, and wounding some 30 other people.
[Lang] The idea was to engage people in the issue
translation.ko: 사람들에게 그런 문제에 관심을 갖게 하고

translation.en: and to give that generation an idea of what Woodstock was about.
translation.ko: 그 세대에게 우드스톡 정신을 알려주자는 취지였어요

translation.en: Which is counterculture.
No violence.
Just peace and love and music.
That was it.
You know, let's do it.
[radio announcer] Experience Woodstock '99 for three days.
Over 40 of today's top bands and 250,000 people.
[man] Let's go!
Woodstock '99, the trip of your life.
[Tom] At the time, Keith and I, we were only 16.
-Love you, Mom. -[laughs]
[Tom] Never been to a concert before.
translation.ko: "톰, 키스" 콘서트에 가 본 적도 없었죠

translation.en: Whoa, I was like, "Korn's gonna be there, Limp Bizkit, Rage Against the Machine."
translation.ko: '레이지 어게인스트 더 머신 콘, 림프 비즈킷이 나온다고?'

translation.en: I was like, "Oh, my gosh. We gotta go."
Tom said, "You wanna go to Woodstock?" "Hell yeah, I wanna go to Woodstock."
translation.ko: 톰이 우드스톡에 가고 싶냐길래 당연히 가고 싶다고 했죠

translation.en: Whoo-hoo! Tickets!
When I got my Woodstock ticket finally, I felt on top of the world.
translation.ko: 우드스톡 표를 샀을 때 세상을 다 가진 기분이었어요

translation.en: Like, wow, this is gonna be probably the best time of my life.
translation.ko: 제 인생 최고의 순간이 될 것 같았죠

translation.en: We're going to see girls our own age and talk to them and possibly have sex.
translation.ko: 우리 또래 여자들을 만나서 얘기하고 섹스도 하고요

translation.en: [Sara] I was very lucky that my parents didn't know anything about it.
translation.ko: 부모님이 그 축제에 대해 모르셔서 다행이었어요

translation.en: I grew up in a very conservative, Christian home,
so I was not allowed to watch MTV.
So, it was kind of a rebellious move to actually have a ticket to Woodstock.
translation.ko: 그래서 우드스톡 표를 산 건 반항적인 행동이었어요

translation.en: [man 1] Whoo!
[man 2] Whoo! We made it!
[Sara] My parents knew about 1969 peace and love,
translation.ko: 부모님은 1969년 축제의 주제가 평화와 사랑이란 걸 아셔서

translation.en: and they're like, "That's a great opportunity for our kid,"
you know, just finding music and harmony.
My hope was to get as fucked up as possible.
Orillia, Ontario! Fucking Ontario!
Whoo!
What's up?
Woodstock '99!
So, that summer of '99, we were doing Isle of MTV,
translation.ko: 1999년 여름에 우린 '아일 오브 MTV'란 프로를 했는데

translation.en: and that was in Nassau, Bahamas, Paradise Island.
You're gonna get to see some of the famous faces
I got to hang out with, here on the Isle of MTV.
Lots of cool people…
But MTV said, "We're gonna send you back to New York for Woodstock '99."
translation.ko: 근데 MTV에서 말하길 뉴욕으로 되돌아가 우드스톡 1999를 찍으라더군요

translation.en: And I was like, "Back to New York?" [laughs]
"I'm in the Bahamas. I don't wanna go back to New York."
[Lewis] But it was gonna be the biggest party on the planet.
A quarter of a million young people,
for three days of incredible music and nonstop partying.
translation.ko: 3일간 멋진 음악을 즐기고 끊임없이 파티를 하는 거죠

translation.en: This was massive.
-[man 1] Right here? -[man 2] Yeah, just drop it.
[man 3] Have your tickets ready.
[guard] Once you get through, your bags will be checked, okay?
[Heather] I was 14. It was my freshman year of high school.
Um, and, you know, I was kind of a tomboy. I had like a bandanna on my head.
translation.ko: 전 말괄량이였어요 머리엔 반다나를 두르고 치아 교정기를 꼈었죠

translation.en: I had a full mouth of braces, right?
translation.ko: 머리엔 반다나를 두르고 치아 교정기를 꼈었죠 "헤더"

translation.en: Like, I was young. I was a virgin, and then some.
I'd been to concerts before,
but never like an overnight… Never like, a festival of this scale.
translation.ko: 1박 이상을 하거나 그런 규모의 축제는 처음이었죠

translation.en: It was huge.
[guard] Ladies and gentlemen, open your bags to speed up the process.
translation.ko: 여러분, 신속한 검사를 위해 가방을 열어주세요

translation.en: [Sara] Security went through my entire bag.
Any food was taken from us. Any drinks, actually, were taken from us.
translation.ko: 음식은 반입할 수 없었고 음료도 전부 빼앗겼어요

translation.en: [Heather] Most of the people that came,
they took their water,
which is so ridiculous, because it's freaking water.
translation.ko: 물도 반입이 안 된다니 어처구니가 없었죠

translation.en: [Scott] Obviously seeing footage from like, '69,
and peace and love, I was picturing like, a big open field.
translation.ko: 평화와 사랑의 행사였고 이번에도 탁 트인 들판을 예상했죠

translation.en: Kind of undulating hills almost like Lord of the Rings,
translation.ko: '반지의 제왕'처럼 굽이치는 언덕과 호빗 같은 거요

translation.en: hobbit-type stuff, and we get there, and I'm like,
translation.ko: '반지의 제왕'처럼 굽이치는 언덕과 호빗 같은 거요 "스콧" 근데 도착했더니

translation.en: "Oh shit."
This is a base.
[man] Ooh.
This is some shit.
[Scott] Like, now I'm wondering, like, are men in black gonna come out?
Is there a UFO in the hangar? I mean, what am I walking into here?
translation.ko: '격납고에 UFO가 있을까? 여긴 뭐 하는 곳이야?'

translation.en: I mean, it literally couldn't be any further away from the original Woodstock.
translation.ko: 원래 우드스톡 축제장과 달라도 너무 달랐죠

translation.en: What the hell happened?
So the elements that you need if you want to put on a festival
translation.ko: 그런 규모의 축제를 준비할 때 필요한 요소는

translation.en: of this kind of scope and size are money, tens of millions of dollars,
translation.ko: 그런 규모의 축제를 준비할 때 필요한 요소는 수천만 달러의 돈과

translation.en: a facility that can house that kind of event,
translation.ko: 그런 종류의 행사를 수용할 수 있는 시설

translation.en: and a powerful partner.
And at that time, one of the biggest players
translation.ko: "존 셰어 우드스톡 기획자" 그 당시 가장 잘나가던 기획자는

translation.en: was John Scher from Metropolitan Entertainment.
You know, I was a pretty successful promoter.
Promoted a lot of big shows.
The Rolling Stones, the Grateful Dead, and The Who.
translation.ko: 롤링 스톤스 그레이트풀 데드, 더 후

translation.en: There's never been an event, ever,
in the history of the music business that's cost anything like this.
translation.ko: 이렇게 돈이 많이 드는 행사는 없었어요

translation.en: [Lang] John Scher is a very feisty guy.
Very tough, and to me, the right kind of partner.
translation.ko: 아주 터프하죠 저한테 딱 맞는 파트너였어요

translation.en: So, I started discussing it with my team.
When I first learned of 1999, I burst out laughing.
translation.ko: 우드스톡 1999 얘기를 듣고 전 웃음을 터뜨렸어요

translation.en: "Come on. What is it, April Fool's Day?"
Surely we're not gonna do that again.
translation.ko: 그걸 다시 하는 건 미친 짓이었죠

translation.en: We had tried to revive Woodstock in 1994.
'94 Woodstock had its problems.
[man] How are things going?
Things are going well, except it's starting to rain a little bit.
translation.ko: 잘돼 가요, 비가 좀 내리는 것만 빼고요

translation.en: It poured rain. The fence came down.
[announcer] Push down the fences and join the party.
At least half of the total audience got in for free.
It's not a free concert. It's a paid concert.
The music was absolutely amazing, but it didn't make any money.
[laughing] And then along comes Woodstock '99.
I mean, we absolutely had to make a profit.
[Rowland] Michael had found a decommissioned 350-acre Air Force base.
translation.ko: 마이클은 폐쇄된 1.4 ㎢ 면적의 공군 기지를 찾아냈어요 "그리피스 공군 기지 뉴욕주 롬"

translation.en: And he thought that meant we could make money.
translation.ko: 기지에서 축제를 열면 돈을 벌 수 있다고 생각했죠

translation.en: They had housing for 15,000 people. They had all the roads.
They had security, they had a hospital.
They had all the stuff that we'd spent millions of dollars to build in '94.
translation.ko: 1994년에 수백만 달러를 들여서 구축했던 시설을 이미 갖추고 있었죠

translation.en: John got totally enthused and energized about doing it again.
translation.ko: 존은 우드스톡을 다시 한다고 기대에 부풀어 있었죠

translation.en: Quite honestly, I thought that, you know, it would make a lot of profit.
translation.ko: 솔직히 큰 수익을 낼 거라고 생각했어요

translation.en: And I think everybody was excited.
Everyone said, "No fucking way." "That's a bad idea."
translation.ko: 다들 이랬어요 '말도 안 돼, 나쁜 생각이야'

translation.en: But John stepped in to overrule the entire board
translation.ko: 하지만 존이 개입해서 이사회 전체의 의견을 뒤집고

translation.en: and saying, "Well, I'm the CEO. We're doing this."
So, we were left doing Woodstock again.
[reporter] History is going to repeat itself,
this time at Griffiss Air Force Base in Rome.
translation.ko: 이번 무대는 롬에 있는 그리피스 공군 기지입니다

translation.en: [Lang] I know what we're going to bring to this area
is going to be the greatest show that anybody has ever experienced.
translation.ko: 우리가 이 지역에서 개최할 우드스톡은 아무도 경험해 보지 못한 최고의 쇼가 될 겁니다

translation.en: This wasn't as tough a decision for me.
Like, a lot of people think,
"Well, why would you put everything at risk politically?"
translation.ko: 많은 사람이 회의적이었어요 "조 그리포 뉴욕주 롬 전 시장" 왜 정치적으로 막대한 위험을 감수하냐면서요

translation.en: I thought it was a good thing for the community at the time,
translation.ko: 당시에는 지역 사회에 도움이 될 것 같았어요

translation.en: particularly after what had happened with the closure of the base.
So I said, "If we could pull this off, this is gonna be remarkable."
translation.ko: 그래서 성공적으로 해내면 굉장할 거라고 생각했죠

translation.en: This will be something that is long remembered in the area.
translation.ko: 이 지역에서 오래도록 기억될 사건이 될 겁니다

translation.en: I know for sure that Rome, New York,
will be known around the world after this summer.
translation.ko: 올여름이 지나면 전 세계에 알려질 겁니다

translation.en: [Scher] To make sure we could sell the tickets,
we booked some of the biggest acts in the world.
Red Hot Chili Peppers, Sheryl Crow, Korn, Limp Bizkit.
translation.ko: 레드 핫 칠리 페퍼스 셰릴 크로, 콘, 림프 비즈킷

translation.en: So everybody felt, I don't want to exaggerate too much,
translation.ko: 너무 과장하고 싶지 않지만 다들 이렇게 생각했죠

translation.en: but that it was maybe gonna be historical.
-Come on, let's go. -You've been working out for a reason.
[Griffo] I remember we decided we were gonna christen the stage in a traditional way.
translation.ko: 전통적인 방식으로 무대에 세례를 주기로 했어요

translation.en: So, we got a tie-dye shirt and a champagne bottle.
translation.ko: 그래서 홀치기 염색 셔츠와 샴페인 병을 준비했죠

translation.en: One, two, three.
The bottle would just not break.
[man 1] You can do it.
-Harder! -[man 2] That's it.
[man 3] Smash it!
-[man 4] It's gonna go! -[man 5] Here it goes!
Why don't you just pop the damn thing?
[Griffo] Looking back on that champagne bottle,
I now realize, uh, maybe in a lot of ways, it was foreshadowing.
[stage announcer] Woodstock '99!
[stage announcer] There you go! Ha-ha!
Holy shit!
Let's get ready to have a good time.
Have fun, party, and go fucking wild!
I was like, "Wow, we're at Woodstock."
"This is happening, don't pinch me."
"I don't want to wake up. This is awesome."
[stage announcer] Woodstock '99 proudly presents
James Brown.
[Scher] So James Brown was supposed to open the festival,
translation.ko: 제임스 브라운이 첫 공연을 하기로 했는데

translation.en: but I didn't have a signed contract.
It's the only act that I didn't have.
translation.ko: 계약서에 서명을 안 한 유일한 출연자였죠

translation.en: His agent kept calling me. James was very insistent
translation.ko: 그의 에이전트가 계속 전화해서 제임스는 보통 다른 공연을 할 때

translation.en: on getting paid full before he went on for most shows.
translation.ko: 공연 전에 출연료 전액을 받길 원한다고 했어요

translation.en: "Mr. Brown's not going on stage unless you pay the rest of the money."
translation.ko: '브라운 씨는 잔금을 받아야 무대에 오를 겁니다'

translation.en: "Mr. Brown's not going on stage. Believe me."
You know, "You're gonna have big trouble here."
So I said to him, "There's 200,000 people here."
"They're not gonna go home if James doesn't play."
translation.ko: '제임스가 공연하지 않으면 집에 안 갈 겁니다'

translation.en: "I'd love him to play."
"I'm not giving you any more money."
So this guy's screaming at me, saying,
"This is your last chance. Either pay him, or he's not going on."
translation.ko: '마지막 기회예요 잔금을 안 치르면 무대에 안 서요'

translation.en: [man 1] James Brown! James Brown! James Brown!
[man 2] Boo!
And I said,
"Do me a favor."
"Just hold on just a minute. I want you to hear something."
"One, two, three."
I said, "Go fuck yourself."
[Scher] James realized the moment.
He knew this wasn't most shows.
translation.ko: 그 공연은 다른 공연과는 다르단 걸요

translation.en: This was Woodstock.
Yeah! Yeah!
It's the biggest party ever. Like, I've never seen this many people.
translation.ko: 사상 최대의 파티예요 이렇게 많은 사람은 처음 봐요

translation.en: [all] Whoo!
[Heather] I was super excited. Bouncing off the walls.
Just head-banging, getting pumped.
Day one, man. Day one.
[man] It's time to find some beer.
They had this big beer garden.
[Lewis] People had, like, three or four beers by like, 11:00.
translation.ko: 11시쯤 사람들은 맥주 서너 잔을 마신 상태였죠

translation.en: I was like, "You're probably not even old enough to drink."
[man] Woodstock Beer Garden. Everyone's wasted.
[man] What's up, Woodstock?
It was pretty free spirit for the drugs.
People are just selling them out in the open.
They're just holding up bags of whatever
and shouting out what they have.
[Keith] I noticed this dude, like, hunched over, he got a backpack on, and he's like,
translation.ko: 어떤 구부정한 남자가 배낭을 메고 있었는데

translation.en: "I got these mushrooms." I'm like, "Well, I'll try them."
translation.ko: 환각 버섯이 있다고 했고 전 해보겠다고 했죠

translation.en: I don't know, I've never done them before.
And so, I'm laying on my back, tripping balls on these mushrooms,
translation.ko: 그래서 반듯하게 누워 환각 버섯에 취한 채

translation.en: and I look up to the sky, I'm like, "Is that a fucking UFO up there?"
I called my mom because she says, "Call me when everything's settled
translation.ko: 엄마한테 전화했어요 축제장에 도착하면 어떤지 알려달라고 하셨거든요

translation.en: and let me know that you're okay." But I had just dropped acid.
translation.ko: 축제장에 도착하면 어떤지 알려달라고 하셨거든요 전 방금 마약을 했고

translation.en: I'm like, "Hey, Mom, this is such a great time."
"I am having the best time." And she goes, "Yeah? What's there?"
translation.ko: '최고의 시간을 보내고 있어요' 뭐가 있냐고 물으시길래

translation.en: I go, "Naked people, everywhere. It's so great."
And she goes, "What'd you say?" And I said, "Oh, I gotta go."
And I clicked.
The nudity. Yeah, it was everywhere.
-Boobs. -Pretty cheerleader.
There were women with notes on their breasts.
Looks good, right? Feels good.
Big, fat, naked dudes. Don't wanna see that.
translation.ko: 거구의 알몸 남성들도 있었죠 보고 싶지 않았어요

translation.en: Nudity is definitely unity.
[stage announcer] Ten dollars, you can get the Woodstock '99 airbrush tattoo
anywhere you like on your body.
[Sara] I think that everybody wants to feel part of something,
translation.ko: 다들 일종의 소속감을 느끼고 싶었나 봐요

translation.en: and seeing so many women get naked
translation.ko: 그렇게 많은 여자들이 알몸으로 즐기는 걸 보니

translation.en: and having such a good time was liberating.
translation.ko: 그렇게 많은 여자들이 알몸으로 즐기는 걸 보니 해방감이 느껴졌어요

translation.en: It was just kind of this free moment
translation.ko: 누구나 자기가 원하는 사람이 될 수 있는

translation.en: for everybody to just be who they wanted to be.
translation.ko: 누구나 자기가 원하는 사람이 될 수 있는 자유의 순간이었죠

translation.en: At that point, it reeked of possibility and optimism.
And we, as the production crew, were just super excited.
I mean, we were young kids in our 20s
trying to pull together something extraordinary.
It was the end of the millennium,
so it felt like it was gonna be this enormous event,
translation.ko: 굉장한 행사가 될 것 같았고 전 뭘 하든 상관없었어요

translation.en: and I didn't really care, really, what I was doing
translation.ko: 굉장한 행사가 될 것 같았고 전 뭘 하든 상관없었어요 "콜린 스피어 제작팀"

translation.en: as long as it wasn't cleaning the porta-potties.
Can you see everybody in the back row?
[Rosenblatt] For me, it was like a dream come true.
I was working with what seemed to be an unlimited budget
translation.ko: 제한이 없는 듯한 예산으로 행사를 준비했고 "리 로젠블랫 현장 관리 부책임자"

translation.en: and many of the top people in their field.
translation.ko: 그 분야의 최고 전문가들과 함께 일했죠

translation.en: [Speir] It was amazing to be able to work with Michael Lang,
the OG organizer of the original Woodstock.
[Law] I was Michael Lang's assistant.
I just was fascinated about how his mind worked, you know?
translation.ko: 그가 사고하는 과정을 보는 건 놀라웠어요

translation.en: He's always super calm.
translation.ko: 그는 항상 침착했고 이런 분위기를 조성했어요

translation.en: There's always this feeling that Michael has it all under control.
translation.ko: 그는 항상 침착했고 이런 분위기를 조성했어요 "필라 로 마이클 랭의 비서" 마이클이 모든 걸 순조롭게 끌고 간다는 분위기요

translation.en: Back row, hands up.
[Law] I wanted to capture my experience.
So, I brought a video camera, and, um, I documented as much as I could.
translation.ko: 그래서 비디오카메라를 가져와서 최대한 많이 기록했죠

translation.en: [woman] What are you doing there?
I was just displaying the site à la the shopping channel.
translation.ko: 쇼핑 채널 스타일로 축제장을 소개하고 있었어요

translation.en: [man] This is a picnic area here in front of us.
translation.ko: 우리 앞에 보이는 곳은 피크닉 장소예요

translation.en: The first impression I had was, "Oh my God, there is a lot of asphalt."
translation.ko: 제가 받은 첫인상은 아스팔트가 많다는 거였어요

translation.en: [Speir] It definitely was not what I expected.
Here was this military, industrial complex
that was being converted into a Woodstock site.
It was these massive airplane hangars
and this incredibly long tarmac landing strip.
It didn't really feel like…
This is Woodstock.
We've developed the master plan of the site here.
We've got about 5,000 acres on the map.
[Rosenblat] Looking down on the site, kind of looks like a big triangle.
On this side of the tarmac is the second stage.
translation.ko: 아스팔트 한쪽에 두 번째 무대가 있었고

translation.en: Over here was the main stage.
Um, up here was the camping area, and down here was the rave hangar
translation.ko: 위쪽엔 야영장 아래쪽엔 레이브 파티 격납고가 있었고

translation.en: and where our offices were,
and it was pretty much just all tarmac in between,
with this impenetrable eight-mile wall around the entire site
translation.ko: 부지 주변엔 13km에 달하는 철옹성 벽이 있었죠

translation.en: so that no one could get in for free.
And the whole plan was to, like, turn it into a Woodstock dreamland.
translation.ko: 그곳을 우드스톡 꿈의 나라로 만들 계획이었어요

translation.en: Ready?
This is the drum. It's called a lollipop drum.
There were a lot of people coming in with a lot of great ideas.
And it's a communal, interactive event,
it's the kind of thing we need around here, I think.
[Rosenblatt] The plans were just amazing.
They had this just beautiful drawings of what they'd do throughout the site.
translation.ko: 부지 전체를 어떻게 꾸밀지 보여주는 멋진 그림이 있었죠

translation.en: Man, it was like a dream come true.
Because the perimeter wall was gonna be profoundly ugly,
we decided to create a peace wall so that it could be beautiful.
translation.ko: 아름답게 보이도록 평화의 벽을 만들기로 했어요

translation.en: I photographed every inch of it.
Yeah, it was gorgeous.
Despite the challenges, uh, we crammed a bunch of amazing things
translation.ko: 힘든 점이 많았지만 축제에 멋진 요소들을 많이 끼워 넣었어요

translation.en: into that festival, from having the Tibetan monks,
translation.ko: 축제에 멋진 요소들을 많이 끼워 넣었어요 티베트 승려들을 초청하고

translation.en: to having the action park, to the movie hangar,
to the giant rave hangar.
[Law] We had high hopes for being able to integrate
some of the original values of '69 into '99.
I think that was kind of naive.
[stage announcer] Ladies and gentlemen,
this year's candidate for the heart and soul of Woodstock,
please welcome Miss Sheryl Crow!
How you doing, all you beautiful naked people?
So, Sheryl Crow, she was booked for the softer rock people.
translation.ko: 셰릴 크로는 소프트록 팬들을 위한 무대였죠

translation.en: ♪ I think a change ♪
♪ Would do you good ♪
♪ Change ♪
♪ Oh, I think a change ♪
♪ Would do me good Would do me good ♪
[Scher] Sheryl's set was fabulous.
But, you know, there were more than a few catcalls.
"Show us your tits!"
Show my tits?
You'd have to pay way more than you paid to get in to see my tits.
translation.ko: 내 젖가슴을 보려면 돈을 훨씬 더 많이 내야 해요

translation.en: She's a beautiful woman, and these guys thought they'd get lucky.
translation.ko: 그녀는 미인이었고 어떤 남자들은 요행수를 바랐죠

translation.en: But it was completely inappropriate.
-And it's a pretty cool… -[man] Nice rack, Sheryl!
-What? -Have you made your peace with the mud?
As soon as I leave, I'm gonna haul my ass out there to the middle of that crowd
translation.ko: 여길 내려가자마자 저 관중 속으로 들어가서

translation.en: and introduce myself to a couple of those f****.
[Scher] And it was sort of the very beginning of us saying,
translation.ko: 그때 처음으로 이런 말을 하기 시작했어요

translation.en: "Hmm, there's an element in this crowd
that is here for more than just great music."
♪ And all the girlies say I'm pretty fly For a white guy ♪
[Holland] Noodles, would you look at all the people out here.
All these goddamn kids being drunk and unruly.
translation.ko: 이 빌어먹을 애들이 술에 취해서 제멋대로야

translation.en: Are you guys proud of yourselves?
What's up '99, man! Whoo!
The environment was just very male ego, like, beat on your chest.
translation.ko: 현장엔 자신을 과시하려는 남자들의 자의식이 가득했죠

translation.en: White college dudes with their shirts off, screaming, "Show me your tits!"
translation.ko: 백인 남자 대학생들이 셔츠를 벗고 '젖가슴을 보여줘!'라고 외쳤어요

translation.en: [Speir] On that first day, we had the Tibetan monks
translation.ko: 첫째 날엔 티베트 승려들이 행사를 축복했고

translation.en: blessing the event, just providing a sense of peace and calm.
translation.ko: 첫째 날엔 티베트 승려들이 행사를 축복했고 평화와 평정심이 느껴졌죠

translation.en: But there were these frat boy types destroying the peacefulness of it,
translation.ko: 하지만 평화로움을 파괴하는 사교 클럽 부류 남학생들이

translation.en: who are just there to be dicks.
Peace, brother!
You know, the '90s, especially the late '90s,
were a very different time.
We're talking about the Bill Clinton scandal.
We're talking about…
American Pie was the most successful R-rated comedy that we had ever had.
translation.ko: '아메리칸 파이'는 가장 성공적인 R 등급 코미디였어요

translation.en: It is brimming with sexuality
from a male perspective.
Then you have Fight Club
with a very interesting take on masculinity, consumerism.
We've all been raised on television to believe one day,
we'd all be movie gods and rock stars, but we won't.
translation.ko: 언젠간 성공한 배우와 록스타가 될 거라 믿었지만 아니야

translation.en: But most importantly, violence.
It's a good snapshot of where the psychology may have been
translation.ko: 그게 우드스톡 1999에 참가했던 많은 젊은이의 심리 상태를

translation.en: of a lot of the kids who attended Woodstock '99.
[Scher] We want everybody to try to remember it's gonna be hot.
translation.ko: 몹시 무더울 거라는 걸 기억해 주세요

translation.en: It's gonna be near 90 today.
Very important to keep drinking and try to keep cool.
translation.ko: 계속 물을 마시고 시원하게 있는 게 중요합니다

translation.en: It was so insanely hot. It was like, 100 degrees.
So obviously, you're dying of thirst
and feeling kind of crazy.
-Whoo! -Yeah!
[Sara] It was so hot that you literally needed to drink a gallon of water an hour
translation.ko: 너무 더워서 시간당 3.8ℓ 정도의 물을 마셔야 탈수 증세를 피할 수 있었죠

translation.en: yourself to stay hydrated.
translation.ko: 시간당 3.8ℓ 정도의 물을 마셔야 탈수 증세를 피할 수 있었죠

translation.en: There were definitely fountains there.
But there was at least a 25-minute wait,
because they didn't let us bring anything in.
So, we went to get just a simple bottle of water.
Nobody could afford that water.
Back then, a bottle of water was probably 65 cents.
But at Woodstock, a bottle of water was a stupid four dollars,
translation.ko: 하지만 우드스톡에서는 물 한 병에 4달러나 해서

translation.en: and it pissed people off.
-Is it more expensive than you thought? -Big, fat rip-off.
Between this and this was nine bucks.
And I was like, "Why the hell is everything, everything so ridiculously expensive?"
translation.ko: 왜 그렇게 모든 게 터무니없이 비싼지 의아했어요

translation.en: [man] Hey, lady.
[Speir] Initially, we all felt we were pulling the same direction,
translation.ko: 처음엔 모두가 같은 방향으로 가고 있고

translation.en: putting together this amazing festival no matter the cost.
translation.ko: 돈이 얼마가 들든 멋진 축제를 준비한다고 생각했죠

translation.en: Why don't you just give me a list of the things you need?
[man, over phone] What I need is at least $250,000.
But then, we all started to get the feeling
that corners were being cut.
So, sincerely as I could possibly be, I really want to thank everybody.
translation.ko: 진심으로 모두에게 고맙다는 말을 하고 싶어요

translation.en: I mean, you guys have been unbelievable.
You've done a fantastic job. You know, this is an extraordinary experience.
There is nothing like this that happens anywhere in the world.
translation.ko: 세상에서 이런 일을 준비하는 사람들은 없어요

translation.en: That being said, um, this is a money-making venture, all right?
And that was the moment for me where it stopped becoming
translation.ko: 그때가 축제의 의미가 변한 순간이었고 축제 참가자들을 위한 행사가 되지 않을 거라는 걸 알았죠

translation.en: about the concert-goer or the festival-goer experience.
translation.ko: 축제 참가자들을 위한 행사가 되지 않을 거라는 걸 알았죠

translation.en: It was just cutting budgets, cutting budgets.
translation.ko: 계속 예산이 삭감됐고 계획을 변경해야 했어요

translation.en: We need to make changes. We're not making profits.
translation.ko: 계속 예산이 삭감됐고 계획을 변경해야 했어요 수익이 안 났으니까요

translation.en: Their goal was to make money.
And what they ended up doing was selling the food rights.
Well, wonderful. Coca-Cola.
[Rosenblatt] And unfortunately, when they did that deal,
the group that ran that for them had complete control over the pricing,
translation.ko: 식품 판매를 대행한 그룹이 가격을 100% 통제해서

translation.en: and we could do nothing about it.
translation.ko: 우리가 할 수 있는 게 없었죠

translation.en: All hopes and dreams of Peace, Love, and Understanding 1969
translation.ko: 1969년의 평화, 사랑, 이해에 대한 모든 희망과 꿈이

translation.en: went out the window.
[Rowland] The underpinning reason of why there was '99 was to make money.
translation.ko: 1999년 축제를 지탱하는 근거는 돈을 버는 거였죠

translation.en: So, I think absolutely some of the sensibilities fell away
translation.ko: 그래서 정서적인 측면에 대한 고려는 사라지고

translation.en: for the big, you know… the big payday.
-You're watching Woodstock '99! -You're watching Woodstock '99!
Rolling four.
I mean, we also wanted to do pay-per-view.
So people who weren't there could still participate.
translation.ko: 축제에 못 온 사람들도 참여할 수 있게요

translation.en: [announcer] Stay home for the trip of your life on pay-per-view.
It was a package price of $59.95 for all three days.
And that yielded a lot of money.
Whoo! What's up?
My name is Aaron Sadovsky, the segment producer with pay-per-view.
translation.ko: 저는 에런 사도프스키입니다 페이퍼뷰 담당 프로듀서죠

translation.en: I was given, essentially, no rules or limits or definitions.
translation.ko: 제한 사항, 구체적인 내용 원칙 같은 것에 대한 지침을 전혀 못 받았어요

translation.en: I'm shooting the people who came here to screw,
the people who came here to do drugs,
and the people who came here to live the life of Woodstock.
translation.ko: 우드스톡의 삶을 경험하러 온 사람들을 찍고 있어요

translation.en: [man] Show him some nipple!
[Sadovsky] So, crazy footage was the goal.
[woman] Whoo! Yeah!
I would just push the crew
and keep coming back with beta tapes full of stuff.
translation.ko: 야한 장면들로 가득한 베타 테이프를 가져오게 했죠

translation.en: Traditionally, the TV coverage of a festival is all about the music,
translation.ko: 전통적으로 페스티벌의 TV 방송은 음악이 전부지만

translation.en: but the pay-per-view element really turned that on its head.
[man] There you go!
[Blaustein] The presence of the pay-per-view cameras
encouraged festival-goers to show off with increasingly wild behavior.
translation.ko: 축제 참가자들은 점점 더 과감한 행동을 보여줬어요

translation.en: It just became like this crazy human zoo.
Pay-per-view! Whoo! I told you I'd get on TV, motherfuckers!
translation.ko: 페이퍼뷰! 아자! TV에서 보는 게 싫어, 개자식들아!

translation.en: Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! You want some of this?
Yeah!
[stage announcer] Whoa baby, how about this fucking show, and it's only Friday!
translation.ko: 이런, 빌어먹을 쇼 이제 겨우 금요일이에요!

translation.en: I remember the kids on the floor saying,
"I'm here for…" and the answer was usually…
translation.ko: 누구를 보러 왔냐고 물으면 대답은 보통…

translation.en: -Korn. -Korn.
-Korn. -Korn.
"I'm here for Korn."
[stage announcer] How many motherfucking Korn fans are in the house tonight?
translation.ko: 오늘 밤 여기에 빌어먹을 콘 팬이 몇 명이나 있죠?

translation.en: At the time, most of the biggest bands, current biggest bands, were hard rock.
translation.ko: 그 당시에 인기 있는 밴드들은 대부분 하드록이었어요

translation.en: Limp Bizkit, Korn, Rage Against the Machine.
translation.ko: 림프 비즈킷, 콘 레이지 어게인스트 더 머신

translation.en: I mean, this was not the hippie-dippie Woodstock '69 lineup.
This music has a lot of rage.
These acts were part of the nü-metal scene.
translation.ko: 누메탈 장르의 음악이었어요 "피터 캣시스 림프 비즈킷의 전 매니저"

translation.en: The aggressiveness of the audience really embodied the rock-and-roll spirit.
translation.ko: 관객의 공격성을 통해 로큰롤 정신이 표현됐었죠

translation.en: We'd seen mosh pits, but now we were talking about mosh pits
translation.ko: 무대 앞을 많이 봐 왔지만 그때 본 무대 앞 관중석은 차원이 전혀 달랐어요

translation.en: on a whole 'nother level.
translation.ko: 그때 본 무대 앞 관중석은 차원이 전혀 달랐어요

translation.en: You had no idea how the crowd was possibly gonna stay in control.
So a couple of days before the festival starts,
we're in a meeting, you know, with all the department heads,
and the 22-year-old me raises my hand,
and I try to bring to everybody's attention
that they need to really look at this lineup of artists.
The bands that John booked, at least the more intense bands,
were not bands I was familiar with. I had no idea who these people were.
translation.ko: 제가 익숙한 밴드들이 아니었고 그들이 누군지도 몰랐어요

translation.en: You know, for the most part, although I ran everything by Michael,
translation.ko: 주로 제 의견을 마이클에게 피력하긴 했지만

translation.en: we never booked an act that he didn't agree with.
translation.ko: 그가 동의하지 않는 밴드는 섭외하지 않았어요

translation.en: So, I was the, you know, the young kid trying to bring some sense
translation.ko: 어린애 하나가 어른들을 앉혀 놓고 가르치려는 꼴이었죠

translation.en: to a room full of adults that had really no idea
translation.ko: 어린애 하나가 어른들을 앉혀 놓고 가르치려는 꼴이었죠 축제에 섭외된 게 어떤 밴드들인지

translation.en: of, I think, the lineup that they put together.
translation.ko: 축제에 섭외된 게 어떤 밴드들인지 아무 감이 없는 어른들한테요

translation.en: And Michael Lang and everyone just looked at me
translation.ko: 그랬더니 마이클 랭과 다른 사람들이 절 쳐다봤죠

translation.en: like I should not open my mouth.
[stage announcer] There you go! Ha-ha!
Holy shit!
In all the shows I have worked, I don't think I have ever seen
translation.ko: 여러 공연장에서 일해봤지만 "카일 무대 경비" 콘의 경우처럼 밴드가 무대에 오르기 전부터

translation.en: the intensity of the crowd before a band came on
translation.ko: 콘의 경우처럼 밴드가 무대에 오르기 전부터 관중이 그렇게 열광하는 건 처음 봤어요

translation.en: like I did with Korn.
translation.ko: 관중이 그렇게 열광하는 건 처음 봤어요

translation.en: We're all sort of looking at each other, saying,
"Holy shit, what is about to happen here?"
[man] Little more high-hat left in the ears.
translation.ko: 왼쪽 이어폰에 드럼 소리 좀 키워주세요

translation.en: The atmosphere backstage was just kind of electric. I was excited.
translation.ko: 무대 뒤 분위기는 고조돼 있었고 전 흥분했었죠 "조너선 데이비스 콘의 리드 싱어"

translation.en: I remember going right to my dressing room
and looking in the mirror, going, "Oh my God, holy fuck."
This is massive.
Me and Tom are like, "We gotta get up to the front of this Korn show."
translation.ko: 저랑 톰은 콘이 공연할 때 앞쪽으로 가고 싶었고

translation.en: We're getting up there, and then we hear the guitar.
translation.ko: 그곳에 갔을 때 기타 소리가 들렸어요

translation.en: There's that guitar riff, that like, dun-nan-nan.
The song starts to build up, build up, and people are starting to go more crazy.
translation.ko: 노래가 진행되면서 사람들은 점점 열광하기 시작했죠

translation.en: I remembered the intro. We're walking out.
I come walking out and I see that fucking crowd.
I'm like, "What the flying fuck?"
When you see it with your own eyes,
it's just ten times more shocking.
He came out and was like, "Are…"
"…you ready?"
The crowd went ballistic.
And I look over, and I see just waves
as the sound traveled all the way to the back.
It was like this unleashing… [grunts] …of all this energy.
There's no drug. There's no nothing on this planet
translation.ko: 어떤 마약도 이 지구상의 어떤 것도

translation.en: that can give you that fucking feeling of having a crowd in your hand like that.
translation.ko: 관중을 그렇게 움직일 수 있다는 느낌보다 좋을 순 없어요

translation.en: [Katsis] Korn had them whipped up into a frenzy.
You kept thinking to yourself,
something's gonna go wrong. What is it? When is it?
translation.ko: 뭔가가 잘못될 거야 그게 뭐지? 언제?

translation.en: They need to calm down.
Come on, Woodstock!
I saw things happen that are unexplainable.
translation.ko: 설명할 수 없는 일이 벌어지는 걸 봤어요

translation.en: I mean, an entire section of the crowd
just instantly moved about six feet to the right.
You can't fall down. Just don't fall down.
Like, you're gonna be forgotten about.
[Kyle] The number of people just coming over the barricade.
It was, you know, a waterfall of bodies.
We needed way more security than we actually had.
translation.ko: 실제 배치된 경비원들보다 훨씬 더 많이 필요했어요

translation.en: It's like the scene from Jaws. I think we need a bigger boat.
translation.ko: '조스'의 한 장면 같았어요 더 큰 배가 필요했죠

translation.en: Come on!
Jeff, I understand you got knocked in your head getting passed.
-You're a big guy. Did they drop you? -Yeah.
-And you lost your camera. -Yeah.
-Would you do it again? -Yeah.
People were breaking their arms, like, "Woodstock '99 is the greatest."
I felt like I did something really incredible.
translation.ko: 내가 대단한 일을 한 것 같았어요

translation.en: We kicked that ass.
[Lewis] Korn has just tore up the stage. They were amazing. Bush is next.
translation.ko: 콘이 무대를 찢어놨어요 정말 대단했죠 다음은 부시였어요

translation.en: And that's only a problem, because where's all this energy gonna go?
translation.ko: 그게 문제였어요 그 많은 에너지가 어디로 가죠?

translation.en: I felt bad for Bush, going on after that, because shit was crazy.
translation.ko: 다음 순서였던 부시가 안됐었죠 우리 무대는 굉장했거든요

translation.en: [stage announcer] Let's hear it for Korn one more time.
translation.ko: 한 번 더 콘에게 큰 박수 부탁드립니다

translation.en: I saw the Korn set from video monitors.
And it was quite scary down there.
I mean, it's a potential runaway train.
Once the crowd gets that amped up, winding them down is very difficult.
translation.ko: 그렇게 흥분한 관중을 진정시키기란 정말 어렵죠

translation.en: [stage announcer] It's Friday, one more band.
Bush.
[Rossdale] This is like, "Now show us what you've got," and…
and that, um, makes you nervous.
I'm fully aware that half the people,
maybe, were kind of more enamored by watching Korn.
translation.ko: 콘의 공연을 보고 더 흥분했다는 걸 알고 있었죠

translation.en: You don't know what's going to happen.
If you can imagine, like,
just jumping off a ship into the darkest ocean.
You know, that's it.
And when that happens, you got to change people's emotion
translation.ko: 그런 일이 생기면 사람들의 기분을 전환해 줘야 해요

translation.en: ♪ Warm sun feed me up ♪
♪ And I'm leery ♪
♪ Loaded up ♪
♪ Loathing… ♪
[Rossdale] We were rather more arm-in-arm than bashing the shit out of each other.
translation.ko: 우린 서로 싸우기보단 팔짱을 끼는 분위기였죠

translation.en: That's what we promote. It's what we like, you know.
translation.ko: 그게 우리가 추구하고 우리가 좋아하는 음악이에요

translation.en: ♪ Swallowed ♪
♪ Sorrowed ♪
♪ Heavy about everything but my love ♪
translation.ko: 사랑 말고는 모든 걸 다 써버렸어

translation.en: He was, you know, like, peace and love and, "I love you, and I love everybody."
translation.ko: 그는 평화와 사랑을 노래했죠 '난 여러분과 모두를 사랑해요'

translation.en: He was like the heartthrob.
[Rossdale] Is everybody happy?
[Scher] Gavin understood the folklore associated with Woodstock.
translation.ko: 개빈은 우드스톡 고유의 문화를 이해하고 있었어요

translation.en: They sort of brought it back to, you know,
the hippies versus the hard rock fans.
translation.ko: 그 문화를 되돌려줬다고 할 수 있죠

translation.en: [Kyle] The crowd was still very lively,
but compared to what had just happened, it was a little bit calmer.
translation.ko: 콘 무대와 비교할 땐 조금은 진정한 상태였죠

translation.en: ♪ You're the wave, you're the wave You're the wave ♪
[Rossdale] I'm proud of that fact we were bringing the crowd back around
to what maybe everyone hoped the event to be,
you know, as opposed to what it deteriorated into.
I think we need to see a whole hell of a lot more!
translation.ko: 훨씬 더 많은 걸 봐야 해요!

translation.en: Woodstock! Whoo!
Woodstock, baby!
[stage announcer] Woodstock '99 day one! Pow!
